title: Inconsistent Behaviour of Single vs Multiple Sessions when using mRemote + RDP Gateway
author: carljessop

comments.snippet:
Hi 

There is no way to restrict the amount of connections allowed within mRemoteNG (yet) as far as I know. mRemoteNG leverages the underlying windows Remote Desktop Binaries and with that can adhere to some group policies, but as far as your issue is concerned there seems to be a difference on how your users connect. May it be the username, computer account or IP used to connect, that's a thing you have to find on your own. Try to compare the connection files, what user they are using and wha...
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet:
Hey there, sorry spring holidays for kids so a bit slow response at all. 
In regards sessions amount its not mRemoteNG who limits what, technically we are implementing Microsoft RDP protocol using they library so we just run it with credentials stored one way or another and the rest is handled by them - not something we could change at the moment. However in regards of different behavior question is what operating system yours guys are using and what amount of memory each computer has. From win...
comments.author: Kvarkas
